data.text: A laboring man that is given to drunkenness shall not be rich:
Wine and women will make men of understanding to fall away:
Moths and worms shall have him to heritage,
He that is hasty to give credit is light-minded;
Whoso taketh pleasure in wickedness shall be condemned:
But he that hateth babbling hath less of evil.
Rehearse not unto another that which is told unto thee,
Whether it be to friend or foe, talk not of other men’s lives;
For he heard and observed thee,
If thou hast heard a word, let it die with thee;
A fool travaileth with a word,
As an arrow that sticketh in a man’s thigh,
Admonish a friend, it may be he hath not done it:
Admonish thy friend, it may be he hath not said it:
Admonish a friend: for many times it is a slander,
There is one that slippeth in his speech, but not from his heart;
Admonish thy neighbor before thou threaten him;
The fear of the Lord is all wisdom;
The knowledge of wickedness is not wisdom,
There is a wickedness, and the same an abomination;
He that hath small understanding, and feareth God,
There is an exquisite subtlety, and the same is unjust;
There is a wicked man that hangeth down his head sadly;
Casting down his countenance, and making as if he heard not:
And if for want of power he be hindered from sinning,
A man may be known by his look,
A man’s attire, and excessive laughter,
